snippet: Investigators found that stolen documents in the possession of Harold T. Martin III included top-secret N.S.A. hacking tools that two months ago were offered for sale on the internet....
abstract: Federal investigators have discovered that large number of stolen documents in possession of National Security Agency contractor Harold T Martin III contain top-secret hacking tools that were posted online for auction by anonymous group known as Shadow Brokers; Martin was arrested in August for stealing government property and mishandling classified information, but so far investigators have been unable to prove he deliberately delivered or sold hacking tools to group.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE, MATT APUZZO and JO BECKER

lead_paragraph: Investigators found that stolen documents in the possession of Harold T. Martin III included top-secret N.S.A. hacking tools that two months ago were offered for sale on the internet.

headline.main: Trove of Stolen Data Is Said to Include Top-Secret U.S. Hacking Tools
headline.print_headline: Hacking Tools Among Data Stolen From U.S.
